title: NY's Plaza named top-rated hotel with The Bellagio in Vegas and London's Mandarin Oriental close behind
text:
7 shares 2

comments
For those with unlimited means, the world is quite literally their oyster. But when you have cash to spare, how do you possibly choose where to stay the night?
From the iconic Ritz in Paris to the opulent Bellagio in Las Vegas and the celebrity-studded Hotel du Cap Eden Roc along the French Riviera, it seems as though the sky is the limit for the world's super-rich.
According to a survey by wealth intelligence company, New World Wealth, multi-millionaires have frequented plenty of award-winning accommodations in the past twelve months, and of the best of the best, they have voted as their absolute favourite.
New York's iconic Plaza Hotel has been ranked the premier hotel to stay in by multi-millionaires from around the world
The five-star property is known for it's grandeur, from the Beaux Arts exterior to Afternoon Tea service at The Palm Court (pictured)
The five-star hotel, located just off of Central Park on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan, is as well known for its Beaux-Arts exterior as it is for its daily Afternoon Tea in its opulent Palm Court restaurant.
It's also the largest of any luxury hotel in New York City, boasting 282 guest rooms, including 102 suites, for the elite to choose from.
And, of course, all suite guests will receive round-the-clock access to the hotel's butler service.
Located just off of Central Park South on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan, its the city's largest luxury hotel, boasting 282 guest rooms
The Plaza also houses plenty of opulent meeting spaces, such as the Oak Room bar, where visitors can indulge in a tipple
The survey used a sample of 'wealthy individuals from all over the world,' though the actual sample size was not disclosed.
Following the top-ranking Plaza Hotel, the Bellagio in Las Vegas came in second, while London's Mandarin Oriental rounded out the top three.
 Even Tahiti couldn't tempt us: Inside a stunning South... Past glories and present delights: The beauty of majestic... A 73mph hypercoaster, air-conditioned capsules and a 400ft... Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc in Antibes, France, and the boutique property of La Mamounia in Marrakech, Morocco, were also among the top five.
The Little Nell in Aspen, Colorado came sixth, while Singapore's Raffles Hotel was ranked seventh and the Ritz Paris snagged eighth place.
THE TOP-RANKED HOTELS FROM AROUND THE WORLD... ACCORDING TO THE SUPER-WEALTHY
1. The Plaza Hotel, New York
2. The Bellagio, Las Vegas
3. Mandarin Oriental, London
4. Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc, Antibes, France
5.La Mamounia, Marrakech, Morocco
6. The Little Nell, Aspen, Colorado
7. Raffles Hotel, Singapore
8. The Ritz, Paris
9. Villa d'Este, Lake Como, Italy
10. Burj Al Arab, Dubai
Ranked second in the survey, which was conducted by New World Wealth, was The Bellagio Hotel in Las Vegas
Rounding out the top three of the top-ranked hotels for multi-millionaires is London's Mandarin Oriental in wealthy Knightsbridge
Along the French Riviera in Antibes, the Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc is a property beloved by businessmen and celebrities alike
For those millionaires looking for a more intimate experience, Marrakech's La Mamounia is a favourite of The Beckhams
TOP 10 HOTELS IN THE UK 1. Mandarin Oriental, London
2. The Ritz, London
3. The Royal Crescent, Bath
4. Claridge's, London
5. Danesfield House Hotel, Marlow
6. The Goring, London
7. Coworth Park, Ascot
8. Le Manoir aux Quat'Saisons, Oxfordshire
9. The Berkeley, London
10. Rockliffe Hall, Hurworth
Villa d'Este in Lake Como, Italy, which is a favourite of A-lister George Clooney, was ranked ninth and Dubai's breathtaking sail-shaped Burj Al Arab property made an appearance on the list in tenth place.
Interestingly, many of these top-ranked hotels for multi-millionaires are reported to be quite small.
The report explains that of the top ten, only the Plaza, the Mandarin Oriental, the Burj Al Arab and the Bellagio have more than 150 rooms.
New World Wealth also found that South Africa was the most popular destination among multi-millionaires visiting the continent of Africa.
In particular, many opted to visit Cape Town, Johannesburg and Kruger National Park - in particular, Sabi Sands.
And while the Mandarin Oriental London came first in the UK-centric list, top marks were also awarded to The Ritz in London and The Royal Crescent in Bath.
Similar as to what was reflected in their international findings, many of the hotels in the UK-focussed list were also small, with many housing under 100 rooms.
Adventurous high-rollers will be keen to spend winter at The Little Nell in Aspen, where they can take advantage of prime skiing conditions
The famed Raffles Hotel in Singapore has played host to everyone from Charlie Chaplin to Prince William and Kate Middleton
The Ritz Paris, situated in Place Vendome, is a palatial hotel in the heart of the city with 159 rooms and an exterior that resembles an 18th century townhouse
In Lake Como, Italy, celebrities such as George Clooney have been known to flock to the bankside Villa d'Este
It's hard to miss the Burj Al Arab in Dubai - just look at its unique sail shape, glittering just off of the sandy coastline
